description:
'''Gianfranco Bortolotti''' ({{IPA|it|dʒaɱˈfraŋko bortoˈlɔtti}}; born 2 May 1959) is an Italian electronic music producer and manager of Media Records and Media Studio. He was a member of [[Cappella (Eurodance group)|Cappella]], and [[49ers (band)|49ers]] who had several hits, and [[Fits of Gloom]], who had a UK No. 47 hit with "[[Heaven (Fits of Gloom song)|Heaven]]" and a UK No. 49 hit with "[[The Power of Love (Fits of Gloom song)|The Power of Love]]" featuring [[Lizzy Mack]]. In the United States, he scored a No. 1 single on [[Dance Club Songs|''Billboard''{{'}}s Dance Club Songs]] chart with "[[Deep in My Heart (song)|Deep in My Heart]]" as a member of the group [[Club House (band)|Clubhouse]] in 1991.

Originally becoming a DJ to supplement his university days, he helped distribute records for [[DJ Pierre]] and after scoring a few minor hits, re-invested money back into Media Records. The success of Media enabled him to invest in at least ten different studios, producing hits at a [[sweatshop]] pace.
